definition: outward devotion but inner opposition (idiom); to pay lip service/to agree overtly, but oppose in secret
positive (electric.)/sun/male principle (Taoism)/Yang, opposite: 陰|阴[yin1]
to offer (tribute)/to present respectfully (to superior, ancestor, deity etc)/to esteem/to revere/to believe in (a religion)/to wait upon/to accept orders (from superior)
variant of 陰|阴[yin1]
surname Yin
overcast (weather)/cloudy/shady/Yin (the negative principle of Yin and Yang)/negative (electric.)/feminine/moon/implicit/hidden/genitalia
to disobey/to violate/to separate/to go against

sentences.english: An honest man will scorn to act a double part.
sentences.chinese: 正直的人不屑于阳奉阴违。

sentences.english: As you know, it is well known how Qi treats missioner.
sentences.chinese: 可是你知道齐国对待使节阳奉阴违是出了名的。

definition: to act as one thinks fit/to have one's own way
two-faced, three knives (idiom); double-cross/double dealing and back stabbing
(idiom) to hesitate/to remain undecided
to harbor evil intentions (idiom); concealing malice
to deceive one's superiors and bully one's subordinates (idiom)
(idiom) to say one thing and do another
see 耍滑[shua3 hua2]
see 居心叵測|居心叵测[ju1 xin1 po3 ce4]
to feign civility (idiom)
lit. see the wind and set the helm (idiom); fig. to act pragmatically/to be flexible and take advantage of the situation
to gang up for personal interest (idiom)/to form a clique
to skimp on the job/to work half-heartedly/not to take the job seriously
to act in collusion (idiom); in cahoots with/villains will look after one another
to play deaf-mute
to decide and act alone (idiom); to take arbitrary action/a law unto oneself
to rebel against the emperor (idiom)
